_prev_prog_3.Description:
As a vital element of the facility?s prevention program, Earthgrains Baking Companies inaugurated a Process Safety Management Program that covers all three ammonia refrigeration processes at this location, as mandated by OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.119 (Process Safety Management).
  
Sara Lee Bakery Group has implemented strict preventive maintenance procedures and an Emergency Action Plan (EAP).  Release of ammonia is specially covered in the Emergency Action Plan and contains all required actions in the event of release of ammonia.  As part of the facility's accidental release prevention, training is conducted for employees and new hires.  Accidental release prevention, training and awareness is reinforced annually and as operations at the facility dictates.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies:

At the Earthgrains Baking Companies, Paris, Texas facility; we handle ammonia that is considered hazardous by EPA.  The same properties that make ammonia valuable as a refrigerant also make it necessary to observe certain safety precautions in handling ammonia to prevent unnecessary human exposure, to reduce the threat to our own personal health as well as our co-workers, and to reduce the threat to nearby members of the community.  It is our policy to adhere to all applicable Federal and State rules and regulations.  Safety depends upon the manner in which we handle ammonia combined with the safety devices inherent in the design of this facility along with the safe operating procedures that we use and the training of our personnel.

2.     The stationary source and regulated substances handled:

The primary purpose of the Earthgrains Baking Companies Paris, Texas facility is the manufacture, packaging and distribution of baked and frozen goods.   Ammonia is used by the facility's refrigeration system to maintain various temperature levels required by production.  Ammonia is contained within a closed refrigeration system and brought into the facility only to charge the refrigeration system when required.  Access to the site is restricted to authorized facility employees, authorized management personnel and authorized contractors.  The regulated substance handled at the Earthgrains Baking Companies Paris, Texas facility is anhydrous ammonia.

The Worst Case Release Scenario(s) and the Alternative Release Scenario(s), including administrative controls and mitigation measures to limit the distances for each reported scenario have been completed as discussed in the following text.

To evaluate both the worst case and alternative release scenarios, EPA's Areal Locations of Hazardous Atmospheres [ALOHA(R)] was utilized exclusively. The Areal Locations of Hazardous Atmospheres [ALOHA(R)] model is referenced in

the RMP Offsite Consequence Analysis Guidance as an acceptable model for the mathematical approximation process. 

As specified in the RMP Guidance, the worst case and alternate case release scenarios have been calculated and the results of the calculations are on file at the Earthgrains Baking Companies.  Public and environmental receptors that could possibly be affected by the scenarios were determined through the use of LANDVIEW 5 mapping system software and US Census Bureau 2000 data.

4.     The general accidental release prevention program and the specific prevention steps.

The purpose of the prevention program is to prevent or minimize the consequences of catastrophic releases of ammonia that may result in toxic hazards.  The prevention program applies to ammonia utilized in the Earthgrains Baking Companies Paris, Texas refrigeration system covered by the EPA RMP standard and the process inventory of ammonia exceeding the specific threshold quantities for individual highly hazardous chemicals listed in CFR 40 Part 68.130 List of Substances.  The prevention program at the Earthgrains Baking Companies Paris, Texas, serves as a means of ensuring that facility work processes conform to defined requirements through the preparation and effective implementation of procedures and instructions.

Risk and process safety programs address the planning, organizing, implementing and controlling of each process as well as the identification of those responsible for managing, performing and verifying the work.  The prevention programs for program level 3 requirements are the same as OSHA PSM requirements with some terminology differences.  The format and minimum policy considerations are based on the Risk Management requirements of the latest edition of the Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 40 Part 68 "Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions".  The prevention program elements comprise twelve (12) major program elements that are aligned with OSHA's PSM standard CFR 29, Part

1910.119 "Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals".

The Earthgrains Baking Companies Paris, Texas facility complies with EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Rule and with all applicable state codes and regulations.  This facility was designed and constructed in accordance with industry accepted practice and is in compliance with the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration ANSI/IIAR 2 Standard for "Equipment, Design, and Installation of Ammonia Mechanical Refrigerating Systems".  All Operators and Technicians have been thoroughly trained using the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration training materials.

5.     Five-year accident history.

 The Earthgrains Baking Companies, Paris, Texas facility has had one accidental release of ammonia in the past five years.  There were no on site, or off site impacts associated with this release.

6.     The emergency response program.

An emergency response program has been implemented at the Plant.  This program contains procedures describing how the facility will respond to fires, ammonia leaks, and other emergencies.  The plan includes evacuation procedures.

The emergency response program includes the following elements:

*   Evacuation Plan
*   Procedures to Address Serious Accidents
*   Ammonia Leak Procedures
*   Emergency Medical Procedures

The program has been coordinated with the Lamar County Local Emergency Planning Committee.

7.     Planned changes to improve safety.

The Earthgrains Baking Companies facility system for managing risk and process safety has been revised to include the original ammonia process as well as the recent addition.  Although the old process is under the threshold requirement, the system has been included in the risk management and process safety management programs.  Additional ammonia sensors are planned for the facility as well as the addition of personnel to provide added surveillance. The new management system is to be formally implemented in 2004.
